god.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a male spirit or being who is believed by some religions to control the world or part of it, or who represents a particular quality
god.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Zeus was one of the most well-known Greek gods.
god.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: someone who is admired very much
god.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: To his fans he is a god.
god.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: something which you give too much importance or respect to
god.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: They prayed to God for forgiveness.
Hinduism tells everyone to worship God in his own faith.
They came to the church to praise God.
About one-third of the population has no belief in God.
Her faith in God helped her deal with her illness.
He believed it was God’s will that they should suffer.
He swore by Almighty God to tell the truth.
Missionaries traveled the world to tell people the word of God.
Life is a gift from God.
Philosophers argued about the existence of God.
god.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: a male spirit or being who is believed by some religions to control the world or part of it, or who represents a particular quality
Odin was the Viking god of war.
Artemis, the Greek goddess of the moon
a god. Deity is more formal than god
a picture or statue that people pray to as a god
someone who does not believe in God
someone who believes that God does not exist
someone who believes that people cannot know whether God exists or not
He was an agnostic rather than an atheist.
god.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the spirit or being who Christians, Jews, Muslims etc pray to, and who they believe created the universe
god.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Prayer is a way of talking to God.
god.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: the spirit or power who Christians, Jews, and Muslims pray to and regard as the maker and ruler of the universe
god.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: We put our faith in God.
